alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Kanawha; Putnam (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 2:29PM EDT until August 07 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston West Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Kanawha County in central West Virginia... Putnam County in western West Virginia... South central Jackson County in northwestern West Virginia... * Until 300 PM EDT. * At 229 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Teays Valley, or near Winfield, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Winfield, St. Albans, Hurricane, Sissonville, Eleanor, Poca, Cross Lanes, Teays Valley, Bancroft, Liberty, and Kentuck. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 4 and 6. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 106 and 125. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 34 and 49. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for central, western and northwestern West Virginia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for central, western and northwestern West Virginia.
